intro: Boucerosia aucheriana, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant blooms and hardy nature. Boucerosia aucheriana is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
